Adding and Subtracting Numbers

add_subtract.add(a, b)[source]

Add two numbers.

Parameters:

  • a (float) – The first number.

  • b (float) – The second number.

Returns:

The sum of the two numbers.

Return type:

float

Examples

>>> add(2, 3)
5

Multiply and Dividing Numbers

multiply_divide.divide(a, b)[source]

Divide one number by another.

Parameters:

  • a (float) – The numerator.

  • b (float) – The denominator.

Returns:

The result of the division.

Return type:

float

Raises:

ZeroDivisionError – If b is zero.

Examples

>>> divide(10, 2)
5.0
multiply_divide.multiply(a, b)[source]

Multiply two numbers.

Parameters:

  • a (float) – The first number.

  • b (float) – The second number.

Returns:

The product of the two numbers.

Return type:

float

Examples

>>> multiply(4, 3)
12
